newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX May up with NYMEX, testing $18.00 price cap.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX May up with NYMEX, testing $18.00 price cap.

text.p: Brent crude prices firmed on Wednesday afternoon in line with a slightly firmer tone on the NYMEX market, although brokers remained sceptical on upside potential.
May was last traded on SIMEX at $18.07 per barrel, up 14 cents from the London settlement. June last traded at $18.15, up 15 cents from overnight levels.
Brokers said a firmer tone on NYMEX helped prices higher in the wake of API stock data overnight. The data showed stocks movements largely in line with market expectations.
On ACCESS, May crude was last traded at $19.45, up 10 cents from New York and just three cents below the intraday high.
Brokers said the API data was largely neutral, although some said the 1.22-million barrel draw in gasoline stocks came despite gasoline production rising 632,000 barrels per day.
However, they said the real test of confidence for the market would come later in London on whether May can close above $18.00.
